results.title: Tim Burton @ ACMI : Highlights of Tim Burton's visit to ACMI
results.brief_description: This is a highlights package of Tim Burton’s time at ACMI. It showcases the events that Tim Burton participated in as well as the peripheral activities that occurred around the Exhibition set up and launch. A celebration of Tim Burton and the exhibition, it includes footage of Tim Burton meeting with the young tour guides, book signings, the masses that filled Federation Square to see the sold out event of Tim Burton’s Masterclass, Burton Club, Media Launch, Official Opening as well behind the scenes footage of installations such as the BatMobile and Balloon Boy.

results.title: Tilt
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, ONF | NFB and World Bank
results.brief_description: A wryly amusing, surrealistic animation using the analogy of the Earth to a ball in a pinball machine being manipulated by pressures arising from inequitable allocation of resources. Emphasises the urgency of finding suitable solutions to the Earth’s problems, how a little more sharing of wealth by the “have” countries might ease many of the world’s economic ills and presents three alternatives. Script by Don Arioli.

results.title: Tiling floors
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Do It Yourself Home Video Workshop. Series 1”.
Michael Byrne demonstrates how to prepare an ideal surface for tiling, how to apply adhesive for proper coverage, how to cut tile efficiently, use decorative borders, mix mortar, incorporate expansion joints and shape a shower recess so it won’t leak. This program is companion to the book, “Setting Ceramic Tile” (The Taunton Press, 1987) and page references appear in the corners of the screen.

results.title: Tikki Tikki Tembo
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Weston Woods Studios and Gary Templeton
results.brief_description: In this charming old Chinese fairy tale, we learn why Chinese parents today give their children little short names instead of great long names. This fable with a moral will delight viewers young and old.

results.title: Tightrope dancer
results.brief_description: Vali Myers is larger than life, or perhaps it’s better to say as large as life. An extraordinary artist and adventurer, her work and philosophies reflect a wild primal spirit that no country or society can contain. At 59, Vali moves between the wilds of her Italian home near Salerno and a hip, limousined, sophisticated life in New York. A leading dancer with a modern dance company at the age of 18, she left Australia for Europe to become a street waif, passing through opium addiction and finally finding relief and peace in her own art. Her flamboyance and her desire to live to the fullest has led her to become a sought after personality.

results.title: Tiger talk
results.creator_credit: Kim Jungeun, Jonathan Dent, BBC and Oxford Film and Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Chris Patten’s east and west”.
Second of the three part documentary series “Chris Patten’s East and West” written and presented by the former British governor of Hong Kong, Chris Patten. In this episode the focus is on the economic crisis which spread across Asia during the late 1990s and the reasons behind the death of the so-called “Asian tigers”. Chris Patten points out once again the often crucial missing link with economical reform is political reform. Both Indonesia and South Korea, “Asian tigers” for several decades were ruled by authoritarian Presidents and in Indonesia’s case, the dictator President Suharto and his corrupt family. By presenting a detailed historical background on South Korea and a briefer outlook on Indonesia, Patten attempts to provide an insight and understanding on Asian economics, the relationship between government and private industry, between free trade and the industrial revolution in Asia, political oppression and student uprisings, company debts and the International Monetary Fund and finally the streamlining of the labor market through redundancies and restructure. Included in the program are interviews with B.J. Habibie (President, Republic of Indonesia 1998), Milton Kim (Chairman, Ssangyong Investment & Securities), and Kim Dae Jung (South Korean Opposition Leader 1961-1997). Contains b&w archival footage and stills.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kim Jungeun, Jonathan Dent, BBC and Oxford Film and Television
